intro: Tecoma oxleyi, commonly known as the yellow trumpet bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and lance-shaped, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. Tecoma oxleyi is adapted to various soil types and is often found in coastal and inland areas.
